intro: Siphocampylus glaber, commonly known as the nakedleaf siphocampylus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant is native to certain regions of North America, particularly in the western United States. It grows in open, rocky habitats and is often found in dry, sunny environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the carrot family, with a unique morphology adapted to its specific ecological niche.
